meanings.definition: Worthy of respect or reverence due to age, wisdom, or character.
meanings.sent1: The old oak tree exuded a sense of venerableness in the forest.
meanings.sent2: The community admired the venerableness of their wise elder.
meanings.sent3: The cat's venerableness was evident as it sat regally on the windowsill.
meanings.sent4: The ancient ruins whispered tales of venerableness to all who visited.
meanings.sent5: The wrinkled face of the storyteller held a certain venerableness that captivated the audience.

meanings.definition: The quality of being esteemed or honored.
meanings.sent1: The venerableness of the award ceremony made everyone feel proud.
meanings.sent2: In the small village, the venerableness of the mayor was unquestioned.
meanings.sent3: The cake's venerableness at the party was short-lived once the children saw it.
meanings.sent4: The venerableness of the historic building drew tourists from far and wide.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's venerableness among the students was well-deserved after years of dedication.
